std::pmr::memory_resource* get_default_resource() noexcept;
}}

Gets the default memory resource pointer.

The ''default memory resource pointer'' is used by certain facilities when an explicit memory resource is not supplied. The initial default memory resource pointer is the return value of {{lc|std::pmr::new_delete_resource}}.

This function is thread-safe. Previous call to {{lc|std::pmr::set_default_resource}} ''synchronizes with'' (see {{lc|std::memory_order}}) the subsequent {{tt|std::pmr::get_default_resource}} calls.

=== Return value ===

Returns the value of the default memory resource pointer.
